      • initStatics

      • makePairwiseConvert

        static MethodHandle makePairwiseConvert(MethodHandle target,
                               MethodType srcType,
                               int level)
        Create a JVM-level adapter method handle to conform the given method handle to the similar newType, using only pairwise argument conversions. For each argument, convert incoming argument to the exact type needed. The argument conversions allowed are casting, boxing and unboxing, integral widening or narrowing, and floating point widening or narrowing.
        Parameters:
        srcType - required call type
        target - original method handle
        level - which strength of conversion is allowed
        Returns:
        an adapter to the original handle with the desired new type, or the original target if the types are already identical or null if the adaptation cannot be made

      • fakeMethodHandleInvoke

        static MethodHandle fakeMethodHandleInvoke(MemberName method)

      • bindCaller

        static MethodHandle bindCaller(MethodHandle mh,
                      Class<?> hostClass)
        Create an alias for the method handle which, when called, appears to be called from the same class loader and protection domain as hostClass. This is an expensive no-op unless the method which is called is sensitive to its caller. A small number of system methods are in this category, including Class.forName and Method.invoke.
